paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the BRCA2 variant 859 + 4A > G/c.631 + 4A > G, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: 59-year-old female proband, her two children, and her deceased father

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband was referred to genetic counselling, since she was diagnosed with breast cancer at the age of 53 and ovarian cancer at the age of 59.
Both mutations were also identified in the proband’s two children.
Both mutations were also identified in the proband’s two children.
Analysis of genomic DNA from paraffin-embedded cancer tissue from the probands deceased father revealed that both mutations were inherited from him.

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2 nucleotide 859 + 4A > G/c.631 + 4A > G mutation results in skipping of exon 7, introducing a premature stop codon.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in the family.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on functional studies and segregation analysis
variants.additional_notes: The BRCA2 mutation is classified as disease-causing due to its effect on splicing.
key_quotes: We therefore classify this mutation as disease causing.
The analysis revealed that the mutation resulted in skipping of exon 7, which introduces a premature stop codon after incorporation of 18 out of frame amino acids.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
